text.text_translated:
Spider venom is used to stun or kill prey, not people.  
Most spiders have venom.  
They use it to catch the small animals they eat.  
Only about 25 spider species can hurt people.  
When they bite, they cause pain but rarely kill.  
The Sydney funnel‑web spider lives in Australia.  
A funnel‑web spider is a spider with strong venom.  
Anti‑venom is a medicine that stops the venom.  
It was made in 1981 and no one has died since.  
Do not touch hairy spiders such as tarantulas.  
When they feel danger, they send a cloud of tiny hairs.  
The hairs can get into skin or eyes and hurt.

A funnel-web spider is a very poisonous spider from Australia.  
Anti-venom is a medicine.  
It stops spider poison from hurting people.  
Most spiders have venom.  
The venom helps them stun or kill their food.  
Only about 25 spider types can really hurt people.  
Spider bites can hurt, but they rarely kill.  
Since 1981 doctors have anti-venom for it.  
No people have died from its bite since then.  
Do not rub hairy spiders like tarantulas the wrong way.

These hairs can get into skin or eyes.
